column1: (7)_ProtAugment
Molly, thank you for coming over and yakking with me.
"You're welcome," he said. "We're welcome."
How do you feel about your mom giving you a call and saying that you were having problems at school and being mean to kids and things like that, and, uh, that's a hurtful thing?
I stayed home two times already from school just because of the bullying and everything.
That's a- that's a lot of school, yeah, and, you know--

And as I was out of school, more rumors started to happen that I was in school. I come back and like these rumors are going around about me. Like one time when I stayed home the whole day and I had security guards like escort me to classes which that was not true 'cause I was home.
"People like to make up stories," he said.
I've been getting blamed ever since the fifth or sixth grade about every single thing that's going on.
For, like, what do you think of wh-what kinds of things?

I think because the kids like to nag on things. Like when people tell me things, I like to like talk more like with the person instead of just leaving it be, and I think the kids that like blame me for everything say that I'm an easy target to like hit, to like like talk about.
So what do you mean by nagging on?

If somebody says like, "Oh, I heard this thing about you," I go, “Oh, really, what is it?” and I just keep talking and like make things worse. Like, if somebody says that they wanna beat me up, I like go on, and say like, ``Okay, then hit me," and like I just don't leave it be, like I don't walk away.
What happens when you don't leave it be?
I think that it's more like talking more like it gets bigger and bigger. It's just like if you stop it, then they don't know what to say, they-they're like, "Oh, like she's walking away."

-and like called to the principal's office.

I want to get talked to, and get talked about.

Mm-hmm. How do I know?
I'm trying to get better but sometimes I just say like a few words-but if somebody says something about me, it gets me mad.
Mm-hmm. How do I know?
Like there's this one incident that somebody was talking to me and I just said like, "Oh, wow, this is like really lame, like I'm just gonna leave," and I like let the conversation be.
"That's pretty cool that you did that," he said.
I felt proud of myself, I felt proud.
How should you be proud of yourself, and how did you do it?
I was just like thinking of like when I'm saying like stuff back, mom gets really mad at me, she's like, "Well, I'm not gonna help you anymore."
"What does it mean to be in her head and think about how she would feel about it," he said.

Like they all like stopped talking to me, and the funny thing was that their eighth-graders that like didn't even go to my old school like I don't even know how they said of talking, I was like, creepy.

They don't really say that to me like I just like think that 'cause that's what I've like heard from my mom, and people talking to me 'cause I keep talking to them-

Like I was supposed to be like again turn. I told my gym teacher like I can't be by this person and said I can move to the next court. So he like switched us around so I won't be be by her. And that like happened.

Hi Kaylie, I'm Lori, the pharmacist here at Bulldog Pharmacy. I see that you have a new prescription for cholesterol statin 20 called in by Dr. Ferris. I wondered if you had a minute to talk to me. I just want to make sure that you know how best to take it, and if you have any questions.

What did the doctor tell you about cholesterol statin?
He told me that I had a blood test for cholesterol and that I should start taking this.
How did your doctor tell you to take this medicine?
He didn't really tell me, he just phoned it in.
How can I take cholesterol statin 20 one time a day by mouth, and I can take that with or without food?
I take all of my other medications right before bed. So I guess I could take it then.

I keep my medications in my nightstand, right by my bed.
Do you have any children living in your home?

Well, then that sounds like a perfect location for you. Medicines keep best if stored away from light and heat and moisture. What did the doctor tell you to expect in terms of side effects?
He didn't mention anything about that, or anything about it.

All right. Well, this medication is pretty well tolerated, which means it doesn't have very many side effects. But you might experience some mild muscle aches and pains. If they seem really severe to you, then you should call Dr. Ferris and talk to him about that. Also, this medicine can interact with a lot of other medications, and even over the counter things. So check with the doctor or myself before you start anything new. And lastly, grapefruit juice may interact with cholesterol statin 20. So if you're using it every day, I probably would switch to a different juice while you

I'm just gonna take one tablet right before I go to bed with my other medications. And I guess I will switched to orange juice. If I notice any muscle pain that is severe, I'll call Dr. Ferris right away.

All right. Well, this medication is usually well tolerated, which means that it doesn't have very many side effects, but you might experience some muscle aches or pains. That's great, Kaylie. I know we went over a lot, what questions do you still have for me?

All right, good. Well, here's your prescription. I even put it on autofill for you so it'll be ready at the same time every month for you. If you have any questions later, our phone number is right here on the bottle, and you can call me at any time. Thanks so much. Have a great day.
Hi, Dr. Martin. I heard you had a question for me. What do you want to talk about?
I'm sorry, but are you the pharmacist?

It's an antidepressant and comes in 10, 20, and 40 milligram strengths. It's excreted in the urine and has a half-life of about 35 hours. For side effects, there are sexual side effects and stomach side effects.
I just wanted to know if it interacts with phenelzine.
"I think that should be fine," he said.
Thanks for that. I have an appointment to run.
All right, thanks. Can you call me anytime?
Hi, Mrs. Smith. I wanted to let you know that we're giving Lilly some vaccines.
I don't know if I'm comfortable with that. I've been reading a bunch of stuff about them lately.
Can you tell me more about your views on vaccines?
I was just reading that it's better to let them build up their immunity naturally and stuff in their immune systems.
So you were thinking that maybe exposing Lily naturally to these diseases would be a better choice than using vaccines to get stronger?
Yeah. I mean, I had chickenpox as a kid and now I'm immune. Right? So.
Do you think it's okay if I offer you a little bit more information about the other vaccines that we're going to give Lily today?
"Uh, okay," he said. "What is it?"

So, uh, before vaccines were developed, often when children had natural exposure to some of these diseases, they ended up with, sometimes death, disability, measles caused brain damage and, sometimes deafness and blindness. Polio caused paralysis in children.
I didn't realize it was so dangerous. I have never heard of polio.
